abstract.shortdesc: Shows information about the cloud's services.
abstract.note:
The euserv-describe-services command replaces the following deprecated commands:
euca_conf --list-* (except --list-nodes)
euca-describe-arbitrators
euca-describe-autoscaling
euca-describe-cloudformation
euca-describe-clouds
euca-describe-cloudwatch
euca-describe-clusters
euca-describe-components
euca-describe-compute
euca-describe-euare
euca-describe-loadbalancing
euca-describe-nodes
euca-describe-object-storage-gateways
euca-describe-services
euca-describe-storage-controllers
euca-describe-tokens
euca-describe-walrusbackends

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock:
euserv-describe-services [-a]
[--group-by-type | --group-by-zone | --group-by-host | --expert] [--show-headers] [--show-empty-fields] [-U URL] [--region USER@REGION] [-I KEY_ID] [-S KEY] [--security-token TOKEN] [--filter NAME=VALUE] [--debug] [--debugger] [--version] [-h] [SVCINSTANCE [SVCINSTANCE ...]]

row.entry: Limit results to specific instances of services.
Show all services regardless of type.
Show advanced information, including service accounts.

Restrict results to those that meet criteria. Allowed filter names:
availability-zone. The service's availability zone.
host. The machine running the service.
internal. Whether the service is used only internally (true or false).
public. Whether the service is public (true or false).
service-group. Whether the service is a member of a specific service group.
service-group-member. Whether the service is public (true or false).
service-type. The service's availability zone
state. The service's availability zone

section.title: Output
section.p: Eucalyptus returns information about the services you specified.

section.title: Example
section.p: Verify that you are looking at the cloud controllers view of the service state by explicitly running against that host:
section.codeblock: euserv-describe-services --filter service-type=storage -U http://localhost:8773/services/Empyrean SERVICE storage one one-sc-1 enabled
